content.description:
An ok route. Probably has the worse rock quality on Red Wall. Crux, and most interesting part of the climb, comes about half way up when the angle steepens abruptly. A little difficult getting established at the chains. Interesting name, sort of like

BAH

on Poudre Face.
content.location: First route (going L to R) on Red Wall.

climbs.name: Red Planet
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, K. Gibson, J. Bowes

content.description: This bouldery route is to the right-most one on this small wall.  It follows a line of bolts to a small roof that leads out left.  There are two two-move cruxes which may lend to pumpy clipping, although there are some decent rests.  A fun route, I thought it was harder than Small Fry.

climbs.name: Red Hot Space Suit
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, K. Gibson, J. Bowes

content.description: Red Hot Space Suit is a continuous, technical, face route. It starts out much less than vertical, then slowly goes to vertical. Most climbers will find the crux at the bulge near the top.
content.protection:
[13] bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains. Per

Travis Bieber

: this looks like it has been retrobolted.
content.location:
The line of bolts just left of

Red Planet

.

content.description:
Natty's starts right at the rap anchors used to reach the Back on Black Wall.  It is the far left route.  Climb a semi-detatched pillar of Red Wall. It shares anchors with

H.R. Puf N Stuff.

Second shorter pitch to

Red Hot Space Suit

. It starts on less than stellar rock and works up to a roof. At this point, you have to grab two jugs on a block that looks questionable (it's super solid as far as I could tell, however). After this is the crux, pulling over the roof on one of the best sequences on any route at the Palace. Seems hard for the grade unless you take a break at the chains of red planet.

Can be done as a single pitch with a 70m rope, just barely. Otherwise to rap to

Red Hot Space Suit

.

Pitch one, two cruxes, first comes about 20 ft off the ground when transitioning out of the crack to a better stance. Second is pulling over the roof towards the end. Big hold and a twist helps. .10c

Pitch two, more vertical going up the column face. Hard to find holds lead to another roof, somewhat easier than the one on the first pitch. .11c

It is definitely a two rope rap.
content.protection:
Pitch 1: 10 bolts and anchors.

Pitch 2: 9 bolts and anchors.

content.description: This forced line climbs the crack system to the left of the line of bolts. Enjoyable face moves are found a the last 2 bolts as you leave the crack system.  It is worth doing once to figure out that you don't need to climb it again.
content.location: This is located on a small pillar to the left of the Red Wall.

content.description:
This is the second shorter pitch to

Uneedalubben

, it has better rock quality, too. The crux comes a few moves after you pull onto the face. Interesting side pulls and footwork make the pitch. It feels hard for the grade.

I was able to do it in one pitch with a 70m rope with some to spare (you might be able to do it with a 60m).
Climb two roofs and then step left. Crumby rock down low provides for some full on undercling/roof sports action.
content.location: This is on the far right side of Red Wall.
